result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Nighbor

records.addlTxt:
2:05 PM Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Christopher L Nighbor.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson states that the matter is resolved; requests a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing
bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

11:37 AM Defendant Christopher L Nighbor in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for Christopher L Nighbor.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court and emailed a copy to Atty Johnson.  Atty Johnson received a copy of the information and waives its reading.   Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
bond continued

11:37 AM Defendant Christopher L Nighbor in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for Christopher L Nighbor.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Christopher L Nighbor. 
Atty Johnson states he has not had a chance to speak with the DA.  Requests Preliminary Hearing which may be a waiver. 
BY THE COURT:  Set for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher L Nighbor
Current: 112 S State St, Neshkoro, WI 54960 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: 10673 Beechnut Dr, Hancock, WI 54943 United States
Bond mailed to defendant for signature and return

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & Atty Johnson waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties. Atty Johnson waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
BY THE COURT:  Set for status.  The initial appearance set for 6/13/22 can be taken off the calendar.

6/7/22:  Modified to No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1.  *Defendant is to submit to a breath test at the request of Law Enforcement with reasonable suspicion of alcohol. *Not to go on the premises of any bar, tavern or establishment that alcohol is the main business 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol

10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Christopher L Nighbor. Also appearing is A.N. by video.
Court recaps file.
Atty Burdon states he continues to object to bond modification.  Atty Johnson makes statement on his motion to modify bond.  Atty Burdon states his concern is based on the allegations in the complaint. 
A.N. called and sworn.  Examined by the Court.  Examined by Atty Burdon.  Examined by Atty Johnson.
BY THE COURT:  Court will modify the bond to no violent or abusive contact with Victim 1.
Status hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:15 am.
of No Contact Provision on Bond
to Modify Bond
Corrected

10:17 AM Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is in the process of hiring an attorney.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give time for the defendant to get an attorney
Initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Prior: 112 S. State St, Neshkoro, WI 54960

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol  *No contact with Victim 1 or her residence  *Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.

3:29 PM Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court confirms address and phone. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Juech requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant is not sure if he can post the cash.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*No contact with Victim 1 or her residence
*Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
